type-parameter.name: SAMtools
type-parameter.doc: File in SAM, BAM or CRAM format.

type-parameter.name: StringIntTable
type-parameter.doc: Tabular file with string keys and integer values.

type-parameter.name: SingleColText
type-parameter.doc: Text file with a single field/entry per line.

input.name: INFILE_infile
input.doc: Input FILE in SAM, BAM or CRAM format (auto-detected).

input.name: INFILE_t
input.doc: FILE listing reference names and lengths. The file is SPACE/TAB delimited with the first two fields of each line consisting of the reference name and the corresponding sequence length. The `.fai' file generated by `samtools faidx' is suitable for use as this file. This may be an empty file if reads are unaligned.

input.name: INFILE_L
input.doc: Only include reads overlapping this BED FILE.

input.name: INFILE_R
input.doc: Only include reads with read group listed in FILE.

output.name: OUTFILE_U
output.doc: Output reads not selected by filters to FILE.

parameter.name: _membycore
parameter.doc: Memory per core. Integer, optionally followed by one the follow suffixes: K, M, G.

parameter.name: _OUTFILE_U
parameter.doc: Switch for enabling the optional output port "-U". Set to true in workflow file if this output is desired.

parameter.name: c
parameter.doc: Print only the count of matching records.

parameter.name: r
parameter.doc: Only include reads in read group STR.

parameter.name: l
parameter.doc: Only include reads in library STR.

parameter.name: q
parameter.doc: Only include reads with mapping quality >= INT.

parameter.name: m
parameter.doc: Only include reads with number of CIGAR operations consuming query sequence >= INT.

parameter.name: f
parameter.doc: Only include reads with all bits set in INT set in FLAG.

parameter.name: F
parameter.doc: Only include reads with none of the bits set in INT set in FLAG.

parameter.name: s
parameter.doc: Integer part sets seed of random number generator; rest sets fraction of templates to subsample [no subsampling].

parameter.name: region
parameter.doc: Only include reads in region STR. A region should be presented in one of the following formats: 'chr1', 'chr2:1000' and 'chr3:1000-2000'. When a region is specified, the input alignment file must be a sorted and indexed alignment (BAM/CRAM) file. It is possible to specify more than one region (as a comma-separated list).
